entry.title: Material Document Goods Receipt Custom Field
entry.content:
Hi Good day 

Any one has done this issue 

so i was basically posting 2 Items Under GR with Custom Field of Date

I'm using script to format the date to epoch from Build Process Automation



This is my Payload


The issue here is whenever the item line of custom field was different it appear on both GR as same data 

for example 

ITEM 1

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",

ITEM 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI":""

The Material Document Items would be 

ITEM 1 & 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",


 FIELD MAPPING

entry.title: CPI RemoveContext deletes a context value
entry.content:
I am facing a strange situation. I am using RemoveContext and the result is 4 context values (removeContext out). However only 3 xml tags are created and the queue of the xml tag shows only 3 context values.

Am I missing something here ? Any idea how this can happen ?

entry.title: Unable to deploy Function Library while Migrating from SAP PO to SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

While working on a B2B migration from SAP PO to SAP CPI, I am adding the Mapping and relevant Function library connecting to ESR and it is imported successfully. Mapping is deployed but the function library deployment is failing with the below error -

[CONTENT][CONTENT_DEPLOY][GenerationFailed] : The generation and build of the artifact were unsuccessful. Please address the issues outlined below and redeploy the artifact. Generation and build failed for B2B_Migration_Function_Library as validation of resource is failed Validation failed for the method concatTwoQueuesToOne defined in the Java class UDFNodePool.java. When the executionType is ALL_VALUES_OF_CONTEXT, there must be at least 3 arguments of which the last argument must always be of type Container and the second last must always be a ResultList. Validation failed for the method createContextsForFixedBlockSize defined in the Java class UDFNodePool.java. When the executionType is ALL_VALUES_OF_CONTEXT, except the last and second last arguments, all others must be of type String [], float [], or int []. Validation failed for the method buildBlocksAndGetValueByIndex defined in the Java class UDFNodePool.java. When the executionType is ALL_VALUES_OF_CONTEXT, except the last and second last arguments, all others must be of type String [], float [], or int [].

Can someone please suggest how this can be rectified? 

Thanks,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite enhancements and governance
Joule Entitlement Assigned to Different Sales Org GA
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are in the process of integrating Joule AI with our SAP systems and have encountered an entitlement-related challenge.

Current Setup:

  1. The Joule entitlement was automatically added to a Global Account that is different from the one where our SAP systems (S/4HANA Cloud, HCM, etc.) are connected.

  2. While adding the Joule service via Partner Manage My Services, the Global Account where our SAP systems are connected was not visible in the selection list, which resulted in the entitlement being assigned to another GA.

  3. SAP support mentioned that the entitlement cannot be reassigned to the other GA since they belong to different organizations.

What We Need Help With:

  • Given that entitlement reassignment is not possible, what are the possible approaches to enable Joule AI for our SAP systems?

  • Is it feasible to create a new subaccount under the GA where Joule entitlement exists and connect our SAP systems there? Would this conflict with our existing setup?

  • Are there any recommended workarounds or best practices for handling such entitlement mismatches?

  • Any additional insights or suggestions from those who have faced similar scenarios would be really helpful.

We want to ensure we follow the recommended approach and avoid impacting our existing SAP landscape.

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Business Partner replication to EWM – General Role (000000) missing
entry.content:
Question:
We are working on an integration between S/4HANA Public Cloud and decentral EWM. When replicating Business Partners from S/4 to EWM (via SAP_COM_0008), we receive the following error in EWM:

Business Partner role 000000 (General) is missing.

In S/4 Public Cloud:

  • The General Role (000000) is not visible in the Maintain Business Partner app.

  • It cannot be manually assigned to a BP.

  • In the Communication Arrangement (SAP_COM_0008), there is no option to add or force this role.

  • In DRF I only see Monitor Replication, Replicate by Replication Model and Replicate by Object Selection. No customizing available to extend the roles sent.

So far it looks like this cannot be solved from the S/4 side.

Possible solution we identified:
On the EWM side, it should be possible to automatically add the General Role to all incoming BPs. This can be done for example via BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND. According to SAP this is the recommended approach in Cloud integrations, since Public Cloud does not expose the General Role for maintenance.

My questions:

  1. Can you confirm that the General Role (000000) indeed cannot be maintained or forced in S/4 Public Cloud?

  2. Is the approach via EWM (BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND) the correct and supported way to fix this?

  3. Are there any other recommended best practices for handling this issue?

Thanks in advance for your input.

entry.title: Timer Integrations in CPI, having null/unix epoch time in
entry.content:
I have a timer based integration which runs only once daily,  I use exception subprocess and mail adapter to log errors, and for some reason my emails coming as makred as striked saying "This message expired on Wednesday, December 31, 1969 7:00 PM."

I tried to manually pass current date as headers using custom headers but it's still not taking the time,

Does anyone faced any similar situations??

entry.title: Best Practices for Enforcing API Governance for Applications Co-located with S/4HANA in Same Cloud I
entry.content:
I have an architectural question regarding API governance and security:

Current Scenario:

  • S/4HANA On-Premise system deployed in AWS cloud infrastructure
  • External applications accessing S/4HANA On-Premise OData/APIs are properly governed through:
    • SAP Cloud Connector (for BTP applications)
    • API Management (for external platform applications)

Challenge: Applications deployed in the same AWS infrastructure as S/4HANA On-Premise can potentially access the OData services/APIs directly, bypassing any API governance layer. This creates a security and governance gap. 

 Questions:

  1. What are the recommended approaches to ensure all API access to S/4HANA On-Premise is properly governed, even for co-located applications?
  2. Are there any reference architectures or best practices for implementing API governance within the same cloud infrastructure
  3. How can we enforce the use of API Management or similar governance layer for applications in the same network?

    Any guidance, documentation links, or reference architectures would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance !


    [Attached simplified architecture diagram showing the scenario]

entry.title: Getting 401 Unauthorized error while triggering a message from Axway B2Bi Tool
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am facing a 401 Unauthorized error in one of my interfaces that uses the HTTPS sender adapter. The partner is attempting to send a message using the Axway B2Bi tool. I have configured authentication with both Basic and OAuth, but in both cases, I receive the same 401 error.

Interestingly, when I test the same interface using Postman with the same set of credentials, it works successfully.

Could anyone who has worked with Axway B2Bi provide some insights on how this issue can be debugged?

 

Thank You,

Aditya

entry.title: Will people still able to access my iflow even after I expose via API Management's Proxy?
entry.content:
Hi,

API management's Proxy is able to discover CI iflow and act as a layer and adding a security that can be implemented via some API policies (access control, etc). Therefore, we are exposing the API proxy's URL instead of the iflow endpoint's URL.

However, if someone knows the iflow endpoint's URL, does that mean the person can bypass the API proxy and access the iflow directly?

 

Thank you.

entry.title: SAP DM - Plant Mapping/Conversion: Integration of different S/4 systems into one DM instance
entry.content:
Hi community,

we're currently implementing SAP DM (Digital Manufacturing) in our company. Due to the fact, that we only have two instances for SAP DM (DEV + PRD), we want to use the plant mapping /conversion as described in SAP help in order to integrate our DEV + QAS S/4 system with the DM Dev instance (https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/integration-guide/mapping-plants-plant-conversion?locale=en-US&q=Plant+mapping).

We activated the mapping and added the mapping values. In our case we want to map the plant 1000 to the SAP DM plant 1000D for the development system and to 1000Q in our QAS-system. That means we added the following entries:
DEVSYSTEM:1000 --> 1000D
QASSYSTEM:1000 --> 1000Q

Based on the documentation that should be all, but it's not working and we don't know why. We already checked the Idoc, which we used for testing (LOIWCS), and it contains the correct sender system partner number as maintained in the mapping. The plant is also correctly send via Idoc, the SAP DM plant 1000D is also set up correctly. 

May be someone here in the community has a hint for us, what the problem could be.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Cloud to EWM fails due to missing General Role
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are currently facing an issue with Business Partner replication via DRF from S/4HANA Public Cloud to a decentral SAP EWM system.

Scenario

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, when we create a Business Partner (with Customer and/or Vendor roles), the General role (000000) is not visible/maintained in the frontend.

  • When replicating this BP via DRF , the message is successfully sent from S/4HANA Cloud.

  • However, in EWM inbound processing , the message fails with an Application Error.

Error Log in EWM

In transaction SRT_MONI, we see the following details:

 

Analysis

  • EWM requires the General BP role (000000) to be present in order to assign and process additional roles (Customer, Vendor, etc.).

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this General role seems to be handled internally, but it is not explicitly replicated via DRF.

  • As a result, the EWM inbound proxy cannot process the payload and throws the application error.

Questions

  1. Is there an official fix or SAP Note that covers this gap (e.g., automatic inclusion of General role during DRF replication)?

  2. If not, do we need to build a custom solution (BAdI / extension in S/4HANA Public Cloud or EWM) to enrich the payload with BP role 000000 before EWM processes it? If yes, is this only possible on the EWM side?

  3. Can confirm whether this scenario is supported out-of-the-box, or if it is out of scope for standard S/4HANA Cloud ↔ EWM integration?

Additional Context

  • The issue is reproducible with any new BP replication.

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the DRF message monitor shows successful processing, but the EWM side always fails with the error mentioned.

  • We already verified that the inbound service BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In is active and the communication arrangement is correct.

Any insights, SAP Notes, or confirmation from SAP would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Call SAP BTP integration suite api from postman failing
entry.content:
Call SAP BTP integration suite api from postman is failing. 

I use the oauth/token url and I am getting successful access_token. I use client_id and client secret here. 

https://XXXXXX.authentication.xxxx.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

When I use the access_token and call below api - it sends back 200 with login page. 

https://xxxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.us10-002.hana.ondemand.com/api/v1/BuildAndDeployStatus(TaskId='LAKEHOUSE_CONNECT')  

Any solution as to what could be problem

entry.title: iFlow is using incorrect credentials. how to update the credentials and redeploy it
entry.content:
Hello,

Received such notification from SAP regarding Integration Flow - 

These repeated connection attempts are significantly impacting the SuccessFactors environment.

From the Cloud Integration side, it appears that the iFlow is using incorrect credentials.

To prevent further issues, we have undeployed the iFlow. Please update the credentials and redeploy it.

Can you please advise where/how to update the credentials, is there any step-by-step guide available?

entry.title: Bad Request with HTTP Reciever Adapter with OAuth2 Client Credential
entry.content:
On SAP cloud integration I have configured an HTTP receiver adapter with OAuth2 client credentials and the appropriate security material. However, calling the API endpoint fails with a bad request error. The same call works with Postman/Bruno, though.
The authorization header with bearer **** can be seen in the request header log, but I believe the token is not present.
Attached is the configuration of the HTTP receiver adapter and the secret material.
A similar configuration works on the PI, but here the ClientId and Client Secret are not used to retrieve the token, but rather the Base64-encrypted token.
Are others experiencing similar problems, or is there a possible solution for this?

entry.title: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content:
Hi,

Anyone have tried integrating from hookdeck to CPI IFlow? What's the Authentication method you use to connect? We have tried using OAuth2(Client Credentials) however it seems like it's not fetching or generating the token from the credentials (service key created in BTP) and getting 401 however when we use Bearer Token and manually input it, it works and is sending to the iFlow successfully.

Has anyone encountered this or what other ways of authentication method can you suggest?

Thanks in advance!
